comment:
* Displays a list of all activities which can be performed
 * for a given intent. Launches when clicked.
 *
 * @deprecated Applications can implement this UI themselves using
 *   {@link androidx.recyclerview.widget.RecyclerView} and
 *   {@link android.content.pm.PackageManager#queryIntentActivities(Intent, int)}

methods.name: protected void onSetContentView()
methods.comment:
* Override to call setContentView() with your own content view to
     * customize the list layout.

methods.name: protected void onListItemClick(ListView l, View v, int position, long id)
protected Intent intentForPosition(int position)
methods.comment:
* Return the actual Intent for a specific position in our
     * {@link android.widget.ListView}.
     * @param position The item whose Intent to return

methods.name: protected ListItem itemForPosition(int position)
methods.comment:
* Return the {@link ListItem} for a specific position in our
     * {@link android.widget.ListView}.
     * @param position The item to return

methods.name: protected Intent getTargetIntent()
methods.comment:
* Get the base intent to use when running
     * {@link PackageManager#queryIntentActivities(Intent, int)}.

methods.name: protected List<ResolveInfo> onQueryPackageManager(Intent queryIntent)
methods.comment:
* Perform query on package manager for list items.  The default
     * implementation queries for activities.

methods.name: public List<ListItem> makeListItems()
methods.comment: * Perform the query to determine which results to show and return a list of them.

methods.name: protected boolean onEvaluateShowIcons()
methods.comment:
* Whether or not to show icons in the list
     * @hide keeping this private for now, since only Settings needs it
     * @return true to show icons beside the activity names, false otherwise

methodNames: protected void onListItemClick(ListView l, View v, int position, long id)
